The HaML Lab is starting in Fall 2023 in the <a href="https://uwm.edu/psychology/">Psychology Department</a> at the <a href="https://uwm.edu/">University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee</a>. We will be recruiting a graduate student to start in Fall 2024.

<div>
<ul class="overview">
<li><img src="images/home_icon1.png" alt="We study how the brain uses cognitive maps to make sense of the world and guide decision making."></li>
<li><img src="images/home_icon2.png" alt="Cognitive maps, which organize structured knowledge, are thought to be critical for learning of the concepts and schemas that help us understand our world."></li>
<li><img src="images/home_icon3.png" alt="We use a combination of model simulations, learning task, and neuroimaging to study how the brain forms and retrieves information from cognitive maps."></li>
<li><img src="images/home_icon4.png" alt="Our work has implications for understanding human learning, illuminating causes of cognitive disorders, and improving machine learning methods."></li>
</ul>
